Fungal infection.description: A fungal infection is caused by fungi that can affect skin, nails, or internal organs. Common types include athlete's foot, ringworm, and yeast infections.
precautions: Keep affected areas clean and dry
Avoid sharing personal items like towels
Complete the full course of treatment

Allergy.description: An allergic reaction occurs when your immune system overreacts to normally harmless substances like pollen, food, or pet dander.
precautions: Consider wearing a medical alert bracelet
Keep your environment clean and dust-free

GERD.description: Gastroesophageal reflux disease occurs when stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus, causing heartburn and other symptoms.
precautions: Don't lie down immediately after eating
Elevate the head of your bed

Diabetes.description: Diabetes is a metabolic disease causing high blood sugar levels. It can lead to serious complications if not properly managed.
precautions: Check feet daily for any wounds

Hypertension.description: High blood pressure is a condition where the force of blood against artery walls is consistently too high, increasing risk of heart disease and stroke.
precautions: Take blood pressure medications as prescribed

Heart attack.description: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart is severely reduced or blocked. This is a medical emergency requiring immediate treatment.
precautions: Do not drive yourself to the hospital
Stay calm and wait for help

Pneumonia.description: Pneumonia is an infection that inflames the air sacs in lungs, which may fill with fluid or pus, causing cough, fever, and breathing difficulty.

Tuberculosis.description: TB is a serious infectious disease that mainly affects the lungs. It spreads through airborne droplets and requires long-term treatment.
precautions: Cover mouth when coughing or sneezing
Ensure good ventilation in living spaces
Wear a mask around others initially

Common Cold.description: The common cold is a viral infection of your nose and throat. It's usually harmless and resolves within 7-10 days.

Migraine.description: Migraine is a neurological condition causing severe, throbbing headaches often accompanied by nausea, light sensitivity, and visual disturbances.
precautions: Rest in a dark, quiet room during attacks
